snippet: A meeting involving Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton and Foreign Minister Sergey V. Lavrov of Russia comes amid reports of heightened activity at Syria’s chemical weapons sites.
abstract: Lakhdar Brahimi, United Nations special envoy on Syria, is mounting diplomatic push for brokered agreement that would lead to ouster of Pres Bashar al-Assad and installation of transitional government; Brahimi, who has support of United States, outlines details of plan after meeting with Sec of State Hillary Rodham Clinton and Russian Foreign Min Sergey V Lavrov in Dublin; announcement comes amid fears that Assad may be considering using chemical weapons.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Dublin, and Ellen Barry from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: A meeting involving Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton and Foreign Minister Sergey V. Lavrov of Russia comes amid reports of heightened activity at Syria’s chemical weapons sites.

headline.seo: U.S. and Russia Meet on Syrian Conflict
headline.main: U.N. Envoy Is Seeking a Deal to Oust Assad From Syria
headline.print_headline: U.N. Envoy Is Seeking a Deal to Oust Assad From Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
